title.en: Development of Materials II: Classes of Materials, Composites
title.et: Materjaliarendus II: materjaliklassid, komposiidid, uudsed materjalid, materjalide disain

faculty.address:
Tartu linn, 
Tartu linn, Tartumaa 
EST

description.en: Students solve problems in development of materials. They collect and analyze theoretical and practical data about properties and design options of materials necessary for given assignments, and propose solutions to the problems of the design of materials.
description.et: Üliõpilased lahendavad materjalide valiku ja arendusega seotud probleeme, kogudes ja analüüsides infot etteantud rakendusteks vajalike materjalide olemasolu, omaduste ja  disainivõimaluste kohta ning pakkudes välja probleemide lahendamise võimalusi.

objectives.en: The goal of the course is development of the skills of students to solve problems in materials design, and to give supplementary knowledge about technological and structural materials, their properties, technologies and applications.
objectives.et: Eesmärgiks on üliõpilaste materjaliarenduslike probleemide lahendamise oskuse arendamine. Kinnistatakse teadmisi tehno- ja struktuursetest materjalidest, nende omadustest, valmistamise ja töötlemise tehnoloogiatest ning rakendustest.

learning_outcomes.en: After the course a student has an overview about technological and structural materials. The person is acquainted with main topics of materials development, can recognize and create relations between materials science and product development, and has knowledge and skills necessary to act in the area of materials research and development.
learning_outcomes.et: Kursuse läbinud üliõpilane omab süsteemset ülevaadet ja laiapõhjalisi teadmisi kaasaegsetest tehnoloogilistest ja struktuursetest materjalidest. Ta tunneb materjaliarenduse suundi ja  aktuaalseid probleeme, oskab ära tunda ja luua interdistsiplinaarseid seoseid materjaliteaduse ja tootearenduse vahel ning omab teadmisi ja oskusi teadus- ja arendustöö tegemiseks materjaliarenduse valdkonnas.

notes.et:
Schedule, lecture materials and supplementary info is available at:

https://teams.microsoft.com/l/team/19%3a20d0ff1ec7c04d86b8047ea5abfe5201%40thread.tacv2/conversations?groupId=e3d14d30-ae1b-493c-a63e-31b0e0d062b1&tenantId=6d356317-0d04-4abc-b6b6-8c9773885bb0

description.et: A test based on questions from the lectures of February-March.
A test based on questions from the lectures of April-May.

The course is passed if one of the tests has a result of at least 40 % and the overall average of the tests is 51 % or higher. However, if a grade is close to a higher value, the student is given the chance to have, for instance, a talk to increase the grade if the students decides so.

grade_preconditions.et: Minimum requirements for positive assessment: if one of the tests has 40 % of the points, the other test has to have 62 % of the points.

grade_evaluation.et: The course is passed if one of the tests has a result of at least 40 % and the overall average of the tests is 51 % or higher: 51% ... 60% - E, 61% ... 70% - C, 81% ... 90% - B, 91% ... 100% - A. Less than 51 % is considered as not passed.

debt_elimination.et:
End of the semester or in the beginning of next semester during the first two weeks.
The time of a test to improve previous result can be discussed, but it should not be later than the last course time in May. A student can take additional chance for each test to improve the result and one more to improve the result of one of the tests. It is recommended to take the test in two weeks time after the first attempt. There is possibility to take a test at any other time based on respective agreement of the participants. The last result of a test will be in effect. Note that there are also limitations from the university rules.

assessment_scale.et: Eristav (A, B, C, D, E, F, mi)
assessment_scale.en: differentiated (A, B, C, D, E, F, not present)

resources.mandatory_materials:
W. D. Callister, Jr. & D. G. Rethwisch. Materials Science and Engineering: An Introduction. John Wiley & Sons, Inc. (9th or 8th edition.)

K. K. Chawla. Composite Materials. Springer.
resources.recommended_materials: Materials Science and Technology: a comprehensive treatment. Editors-in-Chief R.W. Cahn & P. Haasen. Volumes 1, 9, 11, 12, 13, 15, 17 A&B, 18.

name.en: Laboratory of Physics of Ionic Crystals

description.et: Introduction to the course. Installation of software.
Motivation and strategies to design and develop materials. Theoretical approaches to materials design and development. Materials classes and properties: a short overview.
Avogadro (molecular mechanics, Avogadro usage, finished with TNT creation and optimization).  Is LAMMPS installed and working?
Molecular dynamics (MD) basics. LAMMPS. (Artur Tamm).
Density functional theory (DFT) basics. (J. Mattias Kahk).
Results of MD homework. Results of DFT homework.

topic.et: Derivation of "Rules of Mixtures" for composites.
Theoretical calculation/prediction of materials properties (based on known materials).

description.et: Powders.
Fibres.
Laminates, coatings.
Problem solving. Preparation for test.
Test based on sessions of February-March.
Production technologies. Melting. Casting.
Rolling. Mixing. Compacting. 3D printing.
Material treatments (thermal, chemical).
Effect of porosity. Directional solidification.
Problem solving.
Selection of practical works. Discussion of possible solutions.
Dismissed (holiday).
Students presentations of possible solutions and experimental plan considering available materials.

topic.et: Discussion of the results of materials testing (R1).

description.et: Testing of materials (R2).
Testing of materials (R2).
Discussion of the results of materials testing (R2). Conclusions of practical results.
Test based on sessions of April-May.
Final assessment, feedback
